contentrichtext.text: {{Coord|51.040|-4.238|display=title|region:GB_scale:20000}} '''United Services College''' was an English private boys' [[public school (England)|public boarding school]] for the sons of [[military officer]]s, located at [[Westward Ho!]] near [[Bideford]] in North [[Devon]]. It was intended to prepare its pupils for [[military academies]], such as [[Royal Military Academy Sandhurst|Sandhurst]]. ==History== The college was founded in 1874 and was absorbed by the [[Imperial Service College]] in 1906, which in turn merged with [[Haileybury and Imperial Service College|Haileybury]] school in 1942. As at virtually all boys' schools of its era, [[school corporal punishment|corporal punishment]] (strokes of the [[caning|cane]]) was used, but USC was very unusual in that the cane was applied to the student's upper back (as described by Kipling) rather than the buttocks.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} ==Notable former pupils== {{see also|Category:People educated at United Services College}} *[[Rudyard Kipling]], [[writer]]. His collection of stories, ''[[Stalky & Co]]'', is based on his experiences at the College. *Major-General [[Lionel Dunsterville]] [[Order of the Bath|CB]], [[Order of the Star of India|CSI]]. A contemporary of Kipling, he was the inspiration for the character of Stalky, in the ''Stalky & Co.'' stories. *[[Bruce Bairnsfather]], cartoonist and author *[[Colonel (UK)|Colonel]] [[Edward Douglas Brown|Edward Douglas Browne-Synge-Hutchinson]], [[Victoria Cross|VC]], [[Order of the Bath|CB]] (''attended United Services College Day Boy 1875''). He was a [[Major (UK)|Major]] when he earned his [[Victoria Cross|VC]].<ref>Frederick Charles Danvers, (1894), ''Memorials of Old Haileybury College'', page 455, (A. Constable and Company)</ref><ref name="HArchiveRoll">[http://www.haileybury.herts.sch.uk/archives/roll/index.html/ Haileybury College Archives - Roll of Honour]</ref> *[[Brigadier General]] [[George William St. George Grogan]], [[Victoria Cross|VC]], [[Order of the Bath|CB]], [[Order of St Michael and St George|CMG]], [[Distinguished Service Order|DSO & Bar]] (''attended United Services College 1890 - 1893'')<ref name="HArchiveRoll" /> *[[Brigadier General]] The Honourable [[Alexander Gore Arkwright Hore-Ruthven]], [[Victoria Cross|VC]], [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]], [[Order of the Bath|CB]], [[Distinguished Service Order|DSO & Bar]], [[Privy Council of the United Kingdom|PC]], [[Croix de Guerre]] (France and Belgium) *[[Earl of Gowrie]] & [[Viscount Ruthven of Canberra]]. (''attended United Services College 1882.2''). He was a [[Captain (British Army and Royal Marines)|Captain]] when he earned his [[Victoria Cross|VC]].<ref name="HArchiveRoll" /> *[[Brigadier General]] [[Francis Aylmer Maxwell]], [[Victoria Cross|VC]], [[Order of the Star of India|CSI]], [[Distinguished Service Order|DSO & Bar]], (''attended United Services College 1883 - 1890'') <ref name="HArchiveRoll" /><ref>Francis Aylmer Maxwell, (1921), ''Frank Maxwell: A Memoir and Some Letters'', page 9, (J.
